intro: Mesocentron eriophorum, commonly known as the cotton grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its fluffy, white seed heads that resemble cotton, which are produced after the plant has bloomed. The plant typically grows in moist, nutrient-poor environments such as bogs and wet meadows. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Mesocentron eriophorum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
